title: Easiest Herby Tomato Soup with Melted Brie Crostini
ingredients: ['medium tomatoes quartered', 'sweet onion quartered', 'garlic smashed', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'fresh sage leaves', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'canned coconut milk', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese', 'fresh basil roughly, chopped', 'ciabatta bread', 'brie, sliced into 4 slices']
ingredients with measurement: {'medium tomatoes quartered': '6-8', 'sweet onion quartered': '1', 'garlic smashed': '4-6', 'extra virgin olive oil': '3', 'fresh thyme leaves': '2', 'fresh sage leaves': '8', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'canned coconut milk': '1', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese': '1/4', 'fresh basil roughly, chopped': '1/2', 'ciabatta bread': '4', 'brie, sliced into 4 slices': '4'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', '2. In a large oven safe pot, combine the tomatoes, onion, garlic, thyme, 5 sage leaves, olive oil, red pepper flakes, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Transfer to the oven and roast for 20-30 minutes or until the tomatoes begin to char and release their juices. Let cool slightly.', '3. Transfer the roasted tomato mix and their juices to a blender, puree until smooth. Return the soup to the pot and place over medium heat on the stove. Stir in the milk and cheddar cheese. Cook 5-10 minutes, until warmed. Stir in the basil and season the soup with salt and pepper.', '4. Meanwhile, make the crostini. Finely chop the remaining 3 sage leaves. Place the bread on a baking sheet and rub with olive oil. Transfer to the oven and cook 5 minutes. Flip the bread, sprinkle with sage, and add a slice of brie to each. Return to the oven and cook 5 more minutes or until the brie is melted.', '5. To serve, ladle the soup among bowls and top with fresh basil. Serve alongside the brie crostini. Enjoy!']

title: Cheddar Pierogies with Caramelized Onions and Bacon
ingredients: ['all-purpose flour', 'kosher salt', 'salted butter, melted', 'plain full fat greek yogurt, plus more for serving', 'large egg', 'Russet potatoes, peeled and quartered', 'salted butter, at room temperature', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese. plus more for topping', 'cream cheese', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'thick cut slices bacon, chopped', 'salted butter', 'yellow onions, thinly sliced', 'apple cider vinegar', 'fresh thyme leaves']
ingredients with measurement: {'all-purpose flour': '2', 'kosher salt': '1', 'salted butter, melted': '2', 'plain full fat greek yogurt, plus more for serving': '1', 'large egg': '1', 'Russet potatoes, peeled and quartered': '4', 'salted butter, at room temperature': '2', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese. plus more for topping': '2', 'cream cheese': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'thick cut slices bacon, chopped': '4', 'salted butter': '4', 'yellow onions, thinly sliced': '2', 'apple cider vinegar': '3', 'fresh thyme leaves': '1'}
instructions: ['1. To make the dough. In a medium bowl, combine the flour, salt, butter, yogurt, and egg, and mix until combined. Knead the dough for 2-3 minutes. Cover and let sit 30 minutes.', '2. To make the filling.\xa0Bring the potatoes to a boil in a large pot of cold water. Salt the water and cook until the potatoes are tender, about 20 to 30 minutes.', '3. Drain the potatoes, return the potatoes to the pot and mash over low heat, adding the butter, cheddar cheese, and cream cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper.', '4. Roll the dough out onto a floured surface to 1/8 inch thickness. Using a biscuit cutter, cut out 3-inch circles.\xa0Spoon 2 teaspoons of filling into the center of each round. Brush the edges with water and fold half of the dough over the filling to enclose it. Press down the edges to seal, pressing out all the air. Be sure to keep the dough covered as you work to prevent from drying out. At this point, the\xa0pierogi can be flash-frozen on a baking sheet for 30 minutes, then transferred to a freezer bag and frozen for up to 3 months.', '5. When ready to cook, bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Boil the pierogies in batches for 2-3 minutes, or until they float. Drain.', '6. To make the butter sauce, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain onto a paper towel. Wipe the skillet clean, then set back over medium-high heat and melt 1 tablespoon butter. Add the onions and cook 5 minutes, until softened. Add the apple cider, season with salt and pepper and continue cooking another 5-8 minutes, until the cider has evaporated and the onions are golden and caramelized. Add the remaining butter and thyme and cook 2-3 minutes, until the butter is browned.\xa0Remove from the heat.', '7. Drop the pierogies into the sauce, gently tossing to combine. Spoon the pierogies and onions onto plates. Top with cheddar and bacon. EAT!']

title: Roasted Butternut Squash and Spinach Lasagna.
ingredients: ['cubed butternut squash (about 1 medium squash)', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'Vermont Creamery Cultured Butter', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'fresh sage leaves', 'fresh rosemary', 'all-purpose flour', 'whole milk', 'low sodium chicken or vegetable broth', 'fresh grated nutmeg', 'shredded gouda or fontina cheese', 'whole milk ricotta', 'shredded provolone', 'frozen spinach, thawed and drained or 4 cups fresh baby spinach', 'no-boil lasagna noodles', 'thinly sliced prosciutto, torn']
ingredients with measurement: {'cubed butternut squash (about 1 medium squash)': '6', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'Vermont Creamery Cultured Butter': '6', 'garlic, minced or grated': '3', 'fresh sage leaves': '12', 'fresh rosemary': '2', 'all-purpose flour': '1/4', 'whole milk': '2', 'low sodium chicken or vegetable broth': '2', 'fresh grated nutmeg': '1/4', 'shredded gouda or fontina cheese': '1', 'whole milk ricotta': '2', 'shredded provolone': '2', 'frozen spinach, thawed and drained or 4 cups fresh baby spinach': '2', 'no-boil lasagna noodles': '1', 'thinly sliced prosciutto, torn': '3'}
instructions: ['1.\xa0Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.\xa0Lightly butter a 9×13 inch baking dish.', '2. On a baking sheet, toss together the butternut squash, olive oil, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Transfer to the oven and roast for 25-30 minutes or until the squash is tender.', '3.\xa0Meanwhile, make the sauce. Heat the butter, garlic, sage, and rosemary, in a large skillet over medium heat and cook until the butter begins to brown, about 3-4 minutes.\xa0Remove the sage and rosemary from the skillet.\xa0Whisk in the flour and cook for about 1 minute. Slowly add the milk and broth, whisking until combined. Stir in the nutmeg and season with salt and pepper. Bring to a boil and stir for 3-4 minutes. Stir in the gouda or fontina cheese and the spinach. Stir until the cheese is melted. Remove from the heat.', '4. In a medium bowl, mash the roasted butternut squash until mostly smooth. Stir in the ricotta. Season with salt and pepper.', "5.\xa0Spread 1/4 of the cheese sauce in the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Top with 3-4 lasagna sheets. Spread with 1/2 the butternut squash mixture, and then another 1/4 of the cheese sauce, and a handful of provolone. Repeat the layering until all the squash and sauce have been used…don't stress about making it perfect. Arrange the prosciutto on top, if using. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes or until the top has bubbled up and browned a bit. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Top with the reserved fried sage and rosemary. Enjoy!"]

title: Creamed Spaghetti Squash with Browned Butter Walnuts
ingredients: ['medium spaghetti squash, halved and seeds removed', 'salted butter', 'raw walnuts, roughly chopped', 'chopped fresh sage', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'whole milk, nut milk, or canned coconut milk', 'creamy goat cheese, crumbled', 'grated manchego cheese', 'basil pesto, homemade or store-bought', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'kosher salt and black pepper']
ingredients with measurement: {'medium spaghetti squash, halved and seeds removed': '2', 'salted butter': '1', 'raw walnuts, roughly chopped': '1', 'chopped fresh sage': '1-2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '3', 'whole milk, nut milk, or canned coconut milk': '1', 'creamy goat cheese, crumbled': '3', 'grated manchego cheese': '1/3', 'basil pesto, homemade or store-bought': '3', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', '2. Place the squash on a plate and microwave 3 minutes. Let cool slightly, then cut in half lengthwise, scoop out the seeds and discard. Place the squash in a baking dish and season the cut sides with salt and pepper. Transfer to the oven and bake 30-35 minutes or until the squash is tender.', '3. Meanwhile, heat 6 tablespoons butter, the walnuts, sage, and a pinch of salt in a large skillet. Cook 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the butter is browned and the walnuts are toasted. Remove the nuts from the skillet to a plate.', '4. In the same skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons butter with the garlic. Cook until the garlic is fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the crushed red pepper flakes, milk, goat cheese, manchego, and pesto. Season with salt and pepper. Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat, stirring constantly until smooth and creamy. Remove from the heat.', '4. When the squash is ready, use a fork to scrape the squash into strands, then toss the squash with the pesto cream sauce. Serve the squash warm, topped with buttery walnuts.']

title: Cranberry Cider Braised Beef Stew with Rosemary Polenta.
ingredients: ['beef chuck, trimmed and cubed', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'shallots, thinly sliced', 'carrots, chopped', 'apple cider', 'dry red wine, such as Cabernet Sauvignon', 'balsamic vinegar', 'tomato paste', 'brown sugar or honey', 'fresh thyme', 'dried bay leaves', 'fresh cranberries', 'fresh rosemary', 'garlic, smashed', 'dry instant polenta', 'salted butter']
ingredients with measurement: {'beef chuck, trimmed and cubed': '3', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'shallots, thinly sliced': '3', 'carrots, chopped': '6', 'apple cider': '2', 'dry red wine, such as Cabernet Sauvignon': '1', 'balsamic vinegar': '2', 'tomato paste': '2', 'brown sugar or honey': '1', 'fresh thyme': '4', 'dried bay leaves': '2', 'fresh cranberries': '2', 'fresh rosemary': '2', 'garlic, smashed': '2', 'dry instant polenta': '1 1/2', 'salted butter': '3'}
instructions: ['1. Season the beef with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet, sear the beef on both sides. Remove the beef and transfer to the slow cooker.', '2. To the slow cooker, add the shallots and carrots. Add the cider, wine, balsamic vinegar, tomato paste, brown sugar (or honey), thyme, and bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper, gently stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours. During the last 2 hours of cooking, add the cranberries.', '3. To make the polenta. Heat the butter, garlic, and rosemary in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook until the garlic is golden and the rosemary is crisp and "fried", about 3 minutes. Remove the rosemary and reserve. To the pan, add 4 cups water and bring to a boil. Slowly whisk in the polenta, stirring until the polenta is soft and thick, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. If the polenta thickens too much, thin with additional water or cream for an extra luscious polenta.', '4. To serve, remove the thyme and bay leaves from the stew. Serve the stew and gravy over the polenta. Top with crisped rosemary. Enjoy!']

title: Creamy Wild Rice Chicken Soup with Roasted Mushrooms.
ingredients: ['boneless, skinless chicken breasts', 'dry wild rice blend', 'carrots, chopped', 'stalks celery, chopped', 'medium shallots, chopped', 'low-sodium chicken broth', 'chopped fresh thyme or 2 teaspoons dried', 'chopped fresh sage or 1 teaspoon dried', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'fresh baby spinach or kale', 'chopped fresh parsley', 'heavy cream or whole milk', 'grated parmesan, plus more for serving', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'salted butter, melted', 'mixed mushrooms, roughly torn', 'fresh rosemary', 'garlic, smashed', 'zest from 1 lemon']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless, skinless chicken breasts': '1', 'dry wild rice blend': '1 1/2', 'carrots, chopped': '6', 'stalks celery, chopped': '3', 'medium shallots, chopped': '2', 'low-sodium chicken broth': '6', 'chopped fresh thyme or 2 teaspoons dried': '2', 'chopped fresh sage or 1 teaspoon dried': '1', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1/2', 'fresh baby spinach or kale': '2', 'chopped fresh parsley': '2', 'heavy cream or whole milk': '1', 'grated parmesan, plus more for serving': '1/2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'salted butter, melted': '6', 'mixed mushrooms, roughly torn': '2', 'fresh rosemary': '2', 'garlic, smashed': '4', 'zest from 1 lemon': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. In the bowl of your slow cooker, combine the rice, chicken, carrots, celery, shallots, broth, thyme, sage, crushed red pepper, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Add 1/2 cup water. Cover and cook on low for 5-6  hours or on high for 2-3 hours.', '2. Shred the chicken with 2 forks. Stir in the cream, parmesan, and spinach. Cook until warmed through, about 30 minutes. Stir in the parsley. If the soup is thick, add an additional 1/2 cup water.', '3. To make the mushrooms. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.\xa0On a baking sheet, combine the butter, mushrooms, garlic, rosemary, lemon zest, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Transfer to the oven and roast for 25-30 minutes, stirring halfway through cooking, until the mushrooms are golden and crisp', '4. Mash the garlic with a fork, then stir in the mushrooms, mashed garlic, and any butter left into the soup.', '5. Divide the soup among bowls and top with rosemary and additional parmesan.']

title: Cream of Mushroom Soup with Garlic Herb Breadcrumbs
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'garlic, smashed', 'medium shallot, chopped', 'salted butter', 'wild mushrooms, sliced', 'cremini mushrooms, sliced', 'chopped fresh sage', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'balsamic vinegar', 'low sodium chicken or vegetable broth', 'heavy cream or canned coconut milk', 'grated manchego or parmesan cheese', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'roughly torn sourdough bread', 'fresh chopped oregano, or 2 teaspoons dried oregano', 'fresh thyme leaves, or 2 teaspoons dried thyme', 'garlic, smashed', 'kosher salt']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '1/4', 'garlic, smashed': '2', 'medium shallot, chopped': '1', 'salted butter': '4', 'wild mushrooms, sliced': '6', 'cremini mushrooms, sliced': '3', 'chopped fresh sage': '2', 'fresh thyme leaves': '1', 'balsamic vinegar': '1', 'low sodium chicken or vegetable broth': '4-6', 'heavy cream or canned coconut milk': '1', 'grated manchego or parmesan cheese': '1/2', 'roughly torn sourdough bread': '2', 'fresh chopped oregano, or 2 teaspoons dried oregano': '2', 'fresh thyme leaves, or 2 teaspoons dried thyme': '2', 'kosher salt': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Heat the olive oil in a large soup pot over medium heat. When the oil shimmers, add the shallots and garlic, cook until fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. Add the mushrooms, and season with salt and pepper. Cook undisturbed for 5 minutes or until golden, stir and continue cooking until the mushrooms have caramelized, 3-5 minutes. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the butter, sage, and thyme. Cook, stirring occasionally, until very fragrant, about 2-3 minutes. Stir in the balsamic vinegar. Spoon out a handful of the mushrooms for topping, if desired. Add the 4 cups broth, season with salt and pepper.', "2. Transfer about 3/4's of the soup to a blender and pulse until smooth and creamy. Return the soup to the pot with the remaining soup. Stir in the cream and cheese. Season the soup with salt and pepper. Simmer the soup for 5-10 minutes until warmed through, adding the addition 1-2 cups broth as need to thin the soup.", '3. Meanwhile, make the bread. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. On a baking sheet, toss together the bread, olive oil, oregano, thyme, garlic, and a pinch of salt. Transfer to the oven and bake for 10-15 minutes or until toasted.', '4. Ladle the soup into bowls. Top with garlic herb bread and reserved mushrooms.']

title: Brown Butter Brussels Sprout and Bacon Ravioli.
ingredients: ['cheese ravioli', 'thick cut slices bacon, chopped', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'Brussels sprouts, thinly sliced', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'medium shallot, thinly sliced', 'salted butter', 'toasted hazelnuts or pecans, roughly chopped', 'apple cider vinegar', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'zest of 1 lemon', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'grated manchego or parmesan cheese']
ingredients with measurement: {'cheese ravioli': '1', 'thick cut slices bacon, chopped': '4', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'Brussels sprouts, thinly sliced': '3/4', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'medium shallot, thinly sliced': '1', 'salted butter': '4', 'toasted hazelnuts or pecans, roughly chopped': '1/2', 'apple cider vinegar': '2', 'fresh thyme leaves': '1', 'zest of 1 lemon': 'seasoning', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'grated manchego or parmesan cheese': '1/2'}
instructions: ['1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the ravioli according to package directions until al dente. Drain the ravioli.', "2. Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Drain onto a paper towel. Wipe the skillet clean, then set back over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil. Cook until the sprouts are crisping on the edges, 3 to 4 minutes.\xa0Add the shallots, cooking another 2-3 minutes, until caramelized. Remove the Brussels sprouts from the skillet to a plate. It's OK if some of the shallots are left behind in the skillet.", '3. title: Broccoli Cheese Quesadilla with Chipotle Sauce
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil, plus more for cooking', 'head broccoli, cut into florets', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'medium zucchini, and or yellow summer squash, sliced into rounds', 'medium shallot, thinly sliced', 'fresh cilantro or basil, chopped', 'whole wheat or regular flour tortillas', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese, and or Monterey Jack', 'plain greek yogurt, sliced avocado, and fresh limes, for serving', 'chipotle peppers in adobo, finely chopped, plus 2 tablespoons adobo sauce', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'apple cider vinegar', 'honey', 'toasted sesame seeds', 'kosher salt']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil, plus more for cooking': '3', 'head broccoli, cut into florets': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'medium zucchini, and or yellow summer squash, sliced into rounds': '1', 'medium shallot, thinly sliced': '1', 'fresh cilantro or basil, chopped': '1/2', 'whole wheat or regular flour tortillas': '4', 'shredded sharp cheddar cheese, and or Monterey Jack': '3/4', 'plain greek yogurt, sliced avocado, and fresh limes, for serving': 'seasoning', 'chipotle peppers in adobo, finely chopped, plus 2 tablespoons adobo sauce': '2', 'extra virgin olive oil': '3', 'apple cider vinegar': '1', 'honey': '1', 'toasted sesame seeds': '2', 'kosher salt': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over high heat. When the oil shimmers, add the broccoli. Let cook, undisturbed, until the broccoli begins to char on the bottom, but is bright green on top, 4-5 minutes. Add the zucchini and shallots and cook another 3-4 minutes, until the zucchini begins to char. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro and/or basil.', '2. Meanwhile, make the chipotle sesame sauce by stirring together all ingredients in a glass jar.', '3. Lay the tortillas flat on a clean counter. On top of 2 tortillas, evenly layer the cheeses and broccoli/zucchini, drizzle with chipotle sauce, then place the remaining 2 tortillas on top.', '4. title: Better Than Takeout Sweet Thai Basil Chicken.
ingredients: ['sesame or peanut oil', 'ground chicken', 'black pepper', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'fresh ginger, grated', 'red or orange bell peppers, chopped', 'raw cashews', 'low sodium soy sauce or tamari', 'fish sauce', 'honey', 'chili paste', 'fresh basil, roughly torn', 'fresh mint, roughly torn', 'steamed white or brown rice, for serving', 'mango, thinly sliced or diced']
ingredients with measurement: {'sesame or peanut oil': '2', 'ground chicken': '1', 'black pepper': 'seasoning', 'garlic, minced or grated': '4', 'fresh ginger, grated': '1', 'red or orange bell peppers, chopped': '2', 'raw cashews': '1/2', 'low sodium soy sauce or tamari': '1/2', 'fish sauce': '2', 'honey': '1/4', 'chili paste': '2-3', 'fresh basil, roughly torn': '1', 'fresh mint, roughly torn': '1/4', 'steamed white or brown rice, for serving': 'seasoning', 'mango, thinly sliced or diced': '1'}
instructions: ['1. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. When the oil shimmers, add the chicken. Season with black pepper and brown all over, breaking the chicken up as it cooks, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, ginger, peppers, and cashews, cook another 2-3 minutes, until the garlic is fragrant. Pour in the soy sauce, fish sauce, chili paste, and honey. Bring the sauce to a boil over medium-high heat and cook until the sauce coats the chicken, about 5-8 minutes.', '2. Remove from the heat and stir in the basil and mint.', '3. title: Summer Coconut Chickpea Curry with Rice and Fried Halloumi.
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'chickpeas, drained', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'zucchini, or summer squash, diced', 'sweet corn, kernels removed from the cob', 'shallot, chopped', 'fresh ginger, grated', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'yellow curry powder', 'cayenne pepper, more or less to taste', 'coconut milk', 'tahini', 'juice and zest from 1/2 a lemon', 'fresh cilantro, roughly chopped', 'Halloumi cheese, sliced into 1/4 inch pieces', 'cooked basmati rice', 'sesame seeds, green onions, and Persian cucumbers, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '1/4 cup + 4', 'chickpeas, drained': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'zucchini, or summer squash, diced': '2', 'sweet corn, kernels removed from the cob': '2', 'shallot, chopped': '1', 'fresh ginger, grated': '1', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'yellow curry powder': '1 1/2', 'cayenne pepper, more or less to taste': '1/2', 'coconut milk': '1', 'tahini': '2', 'juice and zest from 1/2 a lemon': 'seasoning', 'fresh cilantro, roughly chopped': '1/4', 'Halloumi cheese, sliced into 1/4 inch pieces': '8', 'cooked basmati rice': '2', 'sesame seeds, green onions, and Persian cucumbers, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. When the oil shimmers, add the chickpeas and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring occasionally until the chickpeas begin to crisp, about 5 minutes. Carefully remove 1/2 cup of chickpeas and reserve for topping, only if desired.', '2. To the remaining chickpeas, add the\xa0zucchini, corn, shallot, garlic, and ginger. Season with salt and pepper. Cook the veggies another 5-10 minutes or until they just begin to soften.', '3. Stir in the curry powder and cayenne and cook until\xa0fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the coconut milk, 1/3-1/2 cup water, and the tahini. Stir to combine, bring the mixture to a simmer over medium heat, cook 5-10 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. If the sauce thickens too much, add additional water to thin. When the oil shimmers, add the halloumi and cook until golden, about 3 minutes per side. Remove from skillet.', '5. To serve, divide the rice among bowls and spoon the curry overtop. Top with halloumi, the reserved chickpeas, and cucumbers. Enjoy!']

title: Spicy Chickpea and Cheese Stuffed Zucchini.
ingredients: ['zucchini or yellow summer squash, halved lengthwise', 'cherry tomatoes halved', 'extra virgin olive oil, plus more for serving', 'oregano leaves, roughly chopped', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'chickpeas, drained and rinsed', 'smoked paprika', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'fennel seeds', 'Panko bread crumbs', 'shredded fontina cheese', 'grated pecorino cheese', 'fresh basil leaves, roughly chopped']
ingredients with measurement: {'zucchini or yellow summer squash, halved lengthwise': '4', 'cherry tomatoes halved': '2', 'extra virgin olive oil, plus more for serving': '4', 'oregano leaves, roughly chopped': '2', 'fresh thyme leaves': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'chickpeas, drained and rinsed': '1', 'smoked paprika': '2', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1-2', 'fennel seeds': '1', 'Panko bread crumbs': '1/4', 'shredded fontina cheese': '1/2', 'grated pecorino cheese': '1/4', 'fresh basil leaves, roughly chopped': '1/4'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', '2. Using a small spoon or melon baller, hollow out the center of the zucchini halves (reserve the flesh), leaving 1/2-inch thick shell on each half.', '2. On a baking sheet, toss the zucchini, the scooped out zucchini flesh, and the tomatoes with 2 tablespoons olive oil, oregano, thyme, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Transfer to the oven and roast for 20 minutes or until the zucchini are beginning to char and the tomatoes burst.', '3. On a separate baking sheet, toss the chickpeas with the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil, paprika, red pepper flakes, fennel, and a large pinch of salt. Add the Panko, and toss to coat. Arrange in an even layer and transfer to the oven. Roast for 20 minutes, or until crisp.', '5. Remove everything from the oven. Add the roasted zucchini flesh and the tomatoes to the chickpeas and toss to combine. Spoon half of the chickpea/tomato mix into the roasted zucchini halves. Sprinkle the cheeses evenly over each zucchini. Return the zucchini to the oven and cook another 10 minutes, until the cheese has melted.', '6. To serve, plate the zucchini and top with the reserved chickpeas and tomatoes. Top with fresh basil and a drizzle of olive oil. Enjoy!']

title: Chicken Souvlaki Bowls with Garlic Fries.
ingredients: ['boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size chunks', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'smoked paprika', 'chopped fresh oregano', 'small shallot, chopped', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'zest and juice of 1 lemon', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'zucchini, sliced into 1/4 inch slices', 'crumbled feta cheese', 'fresh pitas or naan bread, warmed', 'Tzatziki, store-bought or homemade', 'cherry tomatoes, halved', 'hummus and shredded lettuce, for serving', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'garlic cloves, minced or grated', 'chopped fresh oregano', 'kosher salt', 'medium russet potatoes, cut into ¼-inch-thick matchsticks']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-size chunks': '2', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1/4', 'smoked paprika': '2', 'chopped fresh oregano': '3', 'small shallot, chopped': '1', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'zest and juice of 1 lemon': 'seasoning', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'zucchini, sliced into 1/4 inch slices': '2', 'crumbled feta cheese': '1/2', 'fresh pitas or naan bread, warmed': '6', 'Tzatziki, store-bought or homemade': '1', 'cherry tomatoes, halved': '1', 'hummus and shredded lettuce, for serving': 'seasoning', 'garlic cloves, minced or grated': '2', 'kosher salt': 'seasoning', 'medium russet potatoes, cut into ¼-inch-thick matchsticks': '4'}
instructions: ['1. In a gallon-size zip-top bag or bowl, combine the chicken, olive oil, paprika, oregano, shallots, garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, crushed red pepper, and a large pinch of salt. Marinate for 15 minutes or up to overnight in the fridge.', '2. Meanwhile, make the fries.\xa0Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.', '3. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, garlic, oregano, and salt. Place the potato matchsticks in a large bowl and pour half the garlic mixture over. Gently toss to coat. Arrange the fries in an even layer on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes, then flip, reduce the oven temperature to 400 degrees F, and bake for 15 to 20 minutes more. Remove from the oven and toss with the remaining garlic oil.', '4. Set your grill, grill pan, or skillet to medium-high heat. Toss the zucchini with the remaining tablespoon olive oil and a pinch of salt and pepper. Take skewers and thread the chicken pieces on.\xa0Alternately, you can roast the chicken at 425 degrees for 15-20 minutes.', '5. Grill the skewers until lightly charred and cooked through, turning them occasionally throughout cooking, about 10 to 12 minutes total. During the same time, grill the zucchini until lightly charred, 3-4 minutes per side. Remove everything from the grill.', '6. To serve, spread the Tzatziki onto warmed naan. Add lettuce, tomatoes, zucchini, and feta. Top with fries and chicken. If desired, add a dollop of hummus. EAT!']

title: Basil Chicken Saltimbocca with Marinated Tomatoes and Burrata
ingredients: ['boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced in half horizontally', 'garlic, grated', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'fresh basil', 'prosciutto', 'large eggs, beaten', 'Panko bread crumbs', 'cherry tomatoes, halved', 'extra virgin olive oil, plus more for cooking', 'balsamic vinegar', 'fresh thyme leaves', 'zest of 1 lemon', 'burrata cheese, torn']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless, skinless chicken breasts, sliced in half horizontally': '2', 'garlic, grated': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'fresh basil': '1', 'prosciutto': '8', 'large eggs, beaten': '3', 'Panko bread crumbs': '2', 'cherry tomatoes, halved': '2', 'extra virgin olive oil, plus more for cooking': '1/4', 'balsamic vinegar': '2', 'fresh thyme leaves': '2', 'zest of 1 lemon': 'seasoning', 'burrata cheese, torn': '3'}

Dredge both sides of the chicken through the egg and then through the Panko, pressing gently to adhere. Place the chicken on a plate.', '3. To make the marinated tomatoes. title: Thai Peanut Chicken Ramen Noodle Salad.
ingredients: ['brown rice ramen noodles, seasoning packet discarded', 'romaine lettuce, shredded', 'carrots, shredded', 'green onions, chopped', 'Persian cucumbers, thinly sliced', 'mango, diced', 'each fresh cilantro and basil, roughly chopped', 'cooked shredded chicken', 'avocado, sliced', 'roasted peanuts, chopped', 'sesame oil', 'rice vinegar', 'creamy peanut butter', 'low sodium soy sauce', 'honey', 'Thai red curry paste', 'juice of 1 lime', 'Jalapeño, chopped, and seeded, if desired']

title: Instant Pot Spicy White Bean, Beef, and Potato Stew
ingredients: ['beef chuck, fat trimmed and cubed', 'sweet onion, diced', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'carrots, chopped', 'mixed baby potatoes, halved', 'hot chili peppers in oil roughly, chopped', 'all-purpose flour or arrowroot powder', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'low sodium beef broth', 'red wine', 'tomato paste', 'sprigs fresh thyme', 'bay leaves', 'white beans, drained', 'winter greens, such as char kale or spinach']
ingredients with measurement: {'beef chuck, fat trimmed and cubed': '2', 'sweet onion, diced': '1', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'carrots, chopped': '4', 'mixed baby potatoes, halved': '1/2', 'hot chili peppers in oil roughly, chopped': '3-4', 'all-purpose flour or arrowroot powder': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'low sodium beef broth': '2', 'red wine': '2', 'tomato paste': '1/3', 'sprigs fresh thyme': '4', 'bay leaves': '2', 'white beans, drained': '1', 'winter greens, such as char kale or spinach': '2'}
instructions: ['1. In the bowl of your instant pot, combine the beef, onion, garlic, carrots, potatoes, chili peppers, flour, and a large pinch of both salt and pepper. Toss to combine. Add the broth, wine, tomato paste, thyme, bay leaves, and season again with salt and pepper. Seal the instant pot and set to the meat/stew setting for 35 minutes.\xa0Preheat the broiler to high.', 'Preheat the broiler to high.', '2. Once the instant pot has finished cooking, Transfer the stew to an oven safe pot. Stir in the white beans and greens. Transfer to the oven and cook for 5-10 minutes, stirring 2-3 times throughout cooking, until the beef is browned and the sauce thickened. Remove from the oven. Remove the thyme and bay leaves. Divide the stew between bowls. Serve with bread. Enjoy!']

title: One Pan Chicken and Wild Rice Casserole
ingredients: ['butter', 'olive oil', 'sweet onions', 'sea salt', 'pepper', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'cremini mushrooms', 'wild mushrooms', 'Honeycrisp apple, thinly sliced', 'fresh chopped thyme, plus more for serving', 'low sodium chicken broth', 'white wine or more chicken broth', 'wild rice', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts', 'baby spinach', 'Gruyère cheese, shredded']
ingredients with measurement: {'butter': '2', 'olive oil': '1', 'sweet onions': '1/2', 'sea salt': 'seasoning', 'pepper': 'seasoning', 'garlic, minced or grated': '2', 'cremini mushrooms': '6', 'wild mushrooms': '2', 'Honeycrisp apple, thinly sliced': '1', 'fresh chopped thyme, plus more for serving': '2', 'low sodium chicken broth': '2 1/2', 'white wine or more chicken broth': '1/2', 'wild rice': '2', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts': '1/2-1', 'baby spinach': '2', 'Gruyère cheese, shredded': '1 1/2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.', '2. Melt the butter and olive oil in a large, oven safe skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook for 5-8 minutes, stirring often until the onion is soft. Season with salt and pepper. Add the garlic, the cremini mushrooms and the wild mushrooms, cook another 5 minutes or until the mushrooms are caramelized. Stir in the apples and thyme and cook another minute longer.', '3. Pour in the 2 cups chicken broth and the wine and bring to a boil over high heat. Stir in the rice and chicken, cover and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 45-55 minutes or until the rice is cooked, if needed, add the remaining 1/2-1 cup broth if the rice feels a little hard still. Remove from the heat and stir in the spinach.', '4. Sprinkle the cheese over top the rice and transfer to the oven. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese has melted. Remove from the oven and serve with fresh thyme. Enjoy!']

title: Roasted Butternut Squash Lasagna
ingredients: ['Fresh Lasagna Noodles*', 'medium Butternut Squash', 'of garlic', 'butter', 'fresh Sage', 'Salt+ Pepper', 'Olive Oil for drizzling', 'Butter', 'Flour', 'Milk', 'nutmeg', 'salt', 'Mascarpone Cheese*', 'Parmesan', 'Mozzarella', 'Mozzarella', 'Parmesan', 'Pepperonis', 'Sage']
ingredients with measurement: {'Fresh Lasagna Noodles*': '1', 'medium Butternut Squash': '2', 'of garlic': '6', 'butter': '5', 'fresh Sage': '2', 'Salt+ Pepper': 'seasoning', 'Olive Oil for drizzling': 'seasoning', 'Butter': '4', 'Flour': '¼', 'Milk': '3', 'nutmeg': '½', 'salt': '½', 'Mascarpone Cheese*': '8', 'Parmesan': '1', 'Mozzarella': '1', 'Pepperonis': 'seasoning', 'Sage': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['For squash and garlic: Lay cubed squash on a baking sheet, and drizzle with a bit of olive oil (only about 1-2 teaspoons). Use your hands to coat the squash with olive oil, then sprinkle with ½ teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Wrap the 6 cloves of garlic in tin foil and drizzle with ½ tsp olive, salt and pepper, place on baking sheet with squash. Roast for 50 minutes, tossing every 15 minutes or so. Remove from oven and sprinkle the squash with the chopped sage. Transfer to a bowl and either mash with a fork or whip them with a mixer. Take the roasted garlic and squeeze the garlic out of if it skins, mash with a fork and combine with the 5 tablespoons of butter. Mix the roasted garlic butter with the squash, making sure the filling is spreadable.']

title: Chili Mango Summer Rolls with Ginger Peanut Sauce
ingredients: ['creamy peanut butter', 'tamari or soy sauce', 'rice vinegar', 'canned coconut milk', 'Thai red curry paste', 'lime juice', 'fresh grated ginger', 'honey', 'lime juice', 'chili sauce', 'rice vinegar', 'small mango, diced', 'fresh Thai basil or cilantro, chopped', 'avocado, sliced', 'vegetables, lettuce leaves, shredded cabbage, carrots, and sliced bell peppers', 'big handful of both fresh cilantro and Thai basil', 'rice paper wrappers']
ingredients with measurement: {'creamy peanut butter': '3/4', 'tamari or soy sauce': '1/3', 'rice vinegar': '2', 'canned coconut milk': '1/4', 'Thai red curry paste': '2-3', 'lime juice': '1/4', 'fresh grated ginger': '1', 'honey': '1/3', 'chili sauce': '1/4', 'small mango, diced': '1', 'fresh Thai basil or cilantro, chopped': '1/4', 'avocado, sliced': '1', 'vegetables, lettuce leaves, shredded cabbage, carrots, and sliced bell peppers': '2-3', 'big handful of both fresh cilantro and Thai basil': '1', 'rice paper wrappers': '8-12'}
instructions: ['1. To make the peanut sauce. Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Thin as desired with additional coconut milk.', '2. To make the mango chili sauce. Combine the honey, lime juice, chili sauce, and vinegar in a bowl. Mix in the mango, cilantro, and basil. Season with salt.', '3. Squeeze a little lime juice over the avocado. Create an assembly line of vegetables or toss all the veggies into a bowl.', '4. Fill a shallow dish with warm water. Add each rice paper sheet, one at a time, for 5 to 10 seconds. Remove and place on a flat surface. Towards one end of the rice wrapper, begin layering avocado, lettuce leaves, herbs, and veggies. Spoon over 2 teaspoons chili sauce. Fold both ends to the center and roll to seal. Keep the rolls covered to prevent them from drying out.', '5. Serve with both dipping sauces. ENJOY!']

title: Spicy Chipotle Honey Salmon Bowls
ingredients: ['salmon filets, cut into bite-size chunks', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'chopped chipotle in adobo', 'honey', 'tamari or soy sauce', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'apple cider vinegar', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'cooked rice', 'avocados, diced', 'small cucumbers, chopped', 'serrano or jalapeño, sliced', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'ground cumin', 'crumbed feta cheese', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'lemon juice', 'lime juice', 'mayo', 'chopped chipotle in adobo', 'honey']
ingredients with measurement: {'salmon filets, cut into bite-size chunks': '4', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'chopped chipotle in adobo': '1-2', 'honey': '2', 'tamari or soy sauce': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'apple cider vinegar': '1', 'fresh cilantro, chopped': '1/2', 'cooked rice': '3-4', 'avocados, diced': '2', 'small cucumbers, chopped': '2', 'serrano or jalapeño, sliced': '1', 'ground cumin': '1/2', 'crumbed feta cheese': '1/2', 'lemon juice': '1', 'lime juice': '1', 'mayo': '1/2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 450° F.', '2. On a baking sheet, toss the salmon pieces with 3 tablespoons olive oil, chipotle in adobo, 2 tablespoons honey, tamari (or soy sauce), and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Arrange in a single layer. Roast 10-15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked to your liking. During the last minute, switch the oven to broil and broil until lightly charred.\xa0Set the salmon aside.', '3. In a small bowl, whisk together 3 tablespoons olive oil, 2 teaspoons honey, and the apple cider vinegar. Stir in the cilantro and season with salt and pepper. Set the sauce aside for serving.', '4. To make the salad. Combine the avocado, cucumbers, serrano pepper, cilantro, cumin, and feta in a bowl. Toss with the olive oil, lime, lemon juice, and season with salt.', '5. For the mayo, combine all ingredients in a bowl.', '6. Spoon the salmon over the bowls of rice. Top with the avocado salad and drizzle the cilantro lime sauce over everyting. Add a dollop of spicy mayo. Enjoy!']

title: One Skillet Cheesy Green Chile Chicken
ingredients: ['boneless skinless chicken breasts', 'cream cheese, at room temperature', 'pepperjack cheese', 'poblano peppers, sliced', 'yellow onion, chopped or sliced', 'chili powder', 'smoked paprika', 'garlic powder', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'salsa verde', 'fresh cilantro and limes for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless skinless chicken breasts': '4', 'cream cheese, at room temperature': '2', 'pepperjack cheese': '4', 'poblano peppers, sliced': '2', 'yellow onion, chopped or sliced': '1', 'chili powder': '1', 'smoked paprika': '1', 'garlic powder': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'salsa verde': '1', 'fresh cilantro and limes for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425° F.', '2. Slice the chicken through the middle horizontally to within a 1/2 inch of the other side. Open the 2 sides and spread them out like an open book. Spread the cream cheese on 1 side of the chicken, then add the pepper jack and a few poblano pepper slices. Fold the other side of the chicken over the peppers/cheese, like a book, to enclose the filling. Place the chicken in the skillet or baking dish. Rub with olive oil.', '3. In a small bowl combine the chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Rub the seasonings all over the chicken.', '4. Sprinkle the remaining poblano peppers and onions around the chicken. Drizzle everything with olive oil, then pour over the salsa verde. Bake 20-25 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through. Serve with fresh cilantro and limes.']

title: Crispy Chicken Katsu Bowls
ingredients: ['tamari or soy sauce', 'toasted sesame oil', 'honey', 'grated ginger', 'chopped green onions', 'sesame seeds', 'chicken cutlets, or 2 boneless chicken breasts, sliced in half horizontally', 'Panko', 'chili flakes', 'frozen shelled edamame', 'rice, cooked', 'cucumber, avocado, pickled ginger, and nori sheets – for serving', 'olive oil mayo', 'sriracha', 'soy sauce or tamari', 'honey']
ingredients with measurement: {'tamari or soy sauce': '2/3', 'toasted sesame oil': '1', 'honey': '1', 'grated ginger': '2', 'chopped green onions': '2', 'sesame seeds': '1', 'chicken cutlets, or 2 boneless chicken breasts, sliced in half horizontally': '4', 'Panko': '1', 'chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'frozen shelled edamame': '1', 'rice, cooked': '3-4', 'cucumber, avocado, pickled ginger, and nori sheets – for serving': 'seasoning', 'olive oil mayo': '1/3', 'sriracha': '1 to 2', 'soy sauce or tamari': '2'}
instructions: ['1. In a medium bowl, combine 2/3 cup tamari/soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, ginger, green onion, 1 teaspoon sesame seeds, and chili flakes.', '2. Place the chicken in a bowl and pour over 3-4 tablespoons of the sauce, save the rest for serving. Let the chicken sit 10 minutes.', '3. Place the Panko and 3 tablespoons sesame seeds in a shallow bowl. Dredge both sides of the chicken through the Panko, pressing to adhere by using your fist to pound the crumbs in. Place the chicken on a plate.', '4. Heat a few tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add the chicken and cook until golden brown, 3-4 minutes. Flip the chicken and cook until golden brown on the other side, about 3-4 minutes. Transfer to a cutting board.', '5. Add the edamame to the skillet, cook until thawed, then add 2 tablespoons tamari/soy sauce. Cook another minute, then remove from the heat.', '6. To make the Spicy Mayo, combine all ingredients in a small bowl.', '7. To assemble, slice the chicken into thin strips. Add the rice to bowls, top with cucumber, avocado, chicken, pickled ginger, green onions, and nori. Spoon over the spicy mayo and the reserved tamari/soy sauce.']

title: Crockpot Spicy Queso Beef Chili
ingredients: ['ground beef', 'yellow onions, chopped', 'poblano peppers, seeded and chopped', 'chili powder', 'garlic powder', 'smoked paprika', 'ground cumin', 'cayenne pepper', 'crushed fire roasted tomatoes', 'tomato paste', 'diced green chilies', 'hot sauce', 'salted butter', 'bay leaves', 'salt', 'chicken or beef broth', 'cream cheese, at room temperature', 'shredded cheddar cheese', 'mixed chili beans, drained', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'chopped green onions', 'avocado and Greek yogurt, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'ground beef': '2', 'yellow onions, chopped': '2', 'poblano peppers, seeded and chopped': '2', 'chili powder': '2', 'garlic powder': '1', 'smoked paprika': '1', 'ground cumin': '2', 'cayenne pepper': '1/2', 'crushed fire roasted tomatoes': '1', 'tomato paste': '1', 'diced green chilies': '1', 'hot sauce': '1/3', 'salted butter': '3', 'bay leaves': '2', 'salt': 'seasoning', 'chicken or beef broth': '2-3', 'cream cheese, at room temperature': '6', 'shredded cheddar cheese': '2', 'mixed chili beans, drained': '1', 'fresh cilantro, chopped': '1/2', 'chopped green onions': '1/4', 'avocado and Greek yogurt, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. In a large dutch oven set over medium high heat, brown the meat all over, breaking up the meat as you go, about 5 minutes. Transfer the beef to the bowl of your crockpot.', '2. Add the onions, poblanos, chili powder, garlic powder, paprika, cumin, and cayenne. Mix in the tomatoes, tomato paste, hot sauce, butter, and diced chilies. Pour over 2 cups broth. Add the bay leaves, season with salt. Stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or hight for 4-5 hours.', '3. Towards the end of cooking, stir in the cream cheese, cheddar cheese, and beans. Cook until the cheese melts, 5 minutes.', '4. Ladle the chili into bowls. Top, as desired. I like Greek yogurt/sour cream, cheese, avocado, cilantro, and green onions. Eat and enjoy!']

title: 30 Minute Korean Beef and Avocado Rice Rolls
ingredients: ['ground beef', 'black pepper', 'garlic, chopped', 'fresh grated ginger', 'tamari or soy sauce', 'Gochujang', 'maple or honey', 'cooked rice', 'chopped green onions', 'cilantro, chopped', 'diced mango', 'bell pepper, sliced', 'diced avocado', 'sesame seeds', 'flour tortillas, warmed', 'chili oil, for serving', 'cream cheese, gently melted', 'mayo', 'sriracha', 'tamari or soy sauce']
ingredients with measurement: {'ground beef': '1 1/2', 'black pepper': 'seasoning', 'garlic, chopped': '4', 'fresh grated ginger': '1', 'tamari or soy sauce': '2', 'Gochujang': '2-3', 'maple or honey': '2-3', 'cooked rice': '2', 'chopped green onions': '1/4', 'cilantro, chopped': '2', 'diced mango': '1/2', 'bell pepper, sliced': '1', 'diced avocado': '1', 'sesame seeds': '2', 'flour tortillas, warmed': '8-10', 'chili oil, for serving': 'seasoning', 'cream cheese, gently melted': '1/3', 'mayo': '3', 'sriracha': '1-2'}
instructions: ['1. In a large skillet, cook the beef with black pepper over medium heat, breaking up the meat as it cooks until browned, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, and ginger, cook another minute. Add the tamari, Gochujang (Korean chili paste), and maple or honey. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the sauce coats the beef, 3-5 minutes. Remove from the heat.', '2. Place one tortilla at a time in the microwave for 15 seconds. Then spoon the beef down the center and top with rice, cilantro, green onion, avocado, mango and/or bell pepper, and then (if using) sesame seeds. Fold the tortilla over the filling. Then fold the sides and ends of the tortillas over the filling and roll forward. Repeat with remaining ingredients.', '3. To make the sriracha sauce, whisk all ingredients in a bowl.', '4. Serve warm with sriracha mayo, chili oil, and limes.']

title: Spicy Buffalo White Chicken Chili
ingredients: ['extra virgin olive oil', 'yellow onion, chopped', 'poblano peppers, seeded and chopped', 'garlic, chopped', 'dried parsley', 'dried chives', 'dried dill', 'smoked paprika', 'kosher salt', 'black pepper', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs', 'low-sodium chicken broth', 'cream cheese, at room temperature', 'white beans, drained', 'buffalo sauce', 'salsa verde', 'shredded cheddar cheese', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'avocado, cheddar cheese, and Greek yogurt, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'yellow onion, chopped': '1', 'poblano peppers, seeded and chopped': '2', 'garlic, chopped': '4', 'dried parsley': '1', 'dried chives': '1', 'dried dill': '2', 'smoked paprika': '1', 'kosher salt': 'seasoning', 'black pepper': 'seasoning', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts or thighs': '1', 'low-sodium chicken broth': '4-6', 'cream cheese, at room temperature': '4', 'white beans, drained': '1', 'buffalo sauce': '3/4', 'salsa verde': '1/2', 'shredded cheddar cheese': '1', 'fresh cilantro, chopped': '1/2', 'avocado, cheddar cheese, and Greek yogurt, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the onion and poblano peppers cook until fragrant, about 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic, parsley, chives, dill, paprika, and a pinch each of salt and pepper. Cook 5 minutes, until very fragrant. Add the chicken, then stir in 4 cups broth. Season with salt and pepper. Partially cover and simmer over medium-low heat for 20 minutes, until the chicken is cooked through.', '2. Pull the chicken out and shred using 2 forks.', '3. Stir in the cream cheese until smooth, slowly letting it melt into the broth. Add the shredded chicken, white beans, salsa verde, buffalo sauce, and cheddar cheese. Cook 5-10 minutes, until the cheese is melted. Remove from the heat and stir in the cilantro. If needed, thin with additional broth.', '4. Ladle the chili into bowls. Top, as desired, with Greek yogurt/sour cream, cheese, avocado, cilantro, and green onions. Eat and enjoy!']

title: Slow Cooker Saucy Sunday Bolognese Pasta
ingredients: ['thick-cut bacon, chopped', 'medium yellow, onions chopped', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'lean ground beef or chicken', 'ground spicy Italian chicken sausage', 'dried oregano', 'dried basil', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'carrots, finely chopped', 'celery stalks, finely chopped', 'crushed San Marzano tomatoes', 'tomato paste', 'dry red wine, such as Sangiovese', 'fresh thyme', 'rigatoni pasta', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'torn sourdough bread', 'fresh oregano leaves', 'grated parmesan cheese', 'crushed red pepper flakes']
ingredients with measurement: {'thick-cut bacon, chopped': '3', 'medium yellow, onions chopped': '2', 'garlic, minced or grated': '6', 'lean ground beef or chicken': '1', 'ground spicy Italian chicken sausage': '3/4', 'dried oregano': '2', 'dried basil': '2', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'carrots, finely chopped': '4', 'celery stalks, finely chopped': '4', 'crushed San Marzano tomatoes': '2', 'tomato paste': '1', 'dry red wine, such as Sangiovese': '1 1/4', 'fresh thyme': '2', 'rigatoni pasta': '1', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'torn sourdough bread': '2', 'fresh oregano leaves': '2', 'grated parmesan cheese': '1/2', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1/2'}
instructions: ['1. Cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 5 minutes. Add the onion, garlic, beef, sausage, oregano, basil, and season with salt and pepper. Brown all over breaking up the meat as you go, about 10 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat.', '2. Transfer the meat to the bowl of your slow cooker. Add the carrots, celery, tomatoes, tomato paste, red wine, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine.\xa0Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 4-6 hours.', '3. Remove the thyme. If the sauce is soupy, crank the heat up to high and cook, uncovered for 20-30 minutes.\xa0If the sauce needs additional liquid, add 1-2 cups water or beef broth.', '4. To make the breadcrumbs. Preheat oven to 425° F. On a baking sheet, toss the bread, with olive oil, oregano, and a pinch of salt. Bake 10 minutes, until toasted. Crumble the bread into fine crumbs using your fingers or pulse in a food processor. Toss with parmesan and red pepper flakes.', '5. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and boil the pasta until al dente according to package directions. Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water. Drain.\xa0Use the pasta water to thin the Bolognese sauce, if needed.', '6. To serve, divide the pasta among bowls and ladle the bolognese over top. Serve topped with breadcrumbs, parmesan, and fresh herbs. Enjoy!']

title: White Wine Braised Short Ribs with Buttered Mushroom Cream Sauce.
ingredients: ['bone-in beef short ribs', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'yellow onion, thinly sliced', 'garlic, smashed', 'dry white wine, such as Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc', 'low sodium chicken broth', 'fresh thyme + 1 tablespoon thyme leaves', 'bay leaves', 'salted butter', 'mixed mushrooms, roughly torn', 'fresh chopped sage', 'Dijon mustard', 'heavy cream', 'grated parmesan', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'mashed potatoes, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'bone-in beef short ribs': '5', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'yellow onion, thinly sliced': '2', 'garlic, smashed': '4', 'dry white wine, such as Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc': '2', 'low sodium chicken broth': '1 1/2', 'fresh thyme + 1 tablespoon thyme leaves': '4', 'bay leaves': '2', 'salted butter': '6', 'mixed mushrooms, roughly torn': '2', 'fresh chopped sage': '1', 'Dijon mustard': '2', 'heavy cream': '1', 'grated parmesan': '1/3', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1', 'mashed potatoes, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Season the short ribs with salt and pepper. Heat a large oven safe skillet over high heat, sear the ribs on both sides. Remove the ribs and transfer to the slow cooker.', '2. To the slow cooker, add the onions, garlic, 1 1/2 cups wine, broth, thyme, and bay leaves. Season with salt and pepper, gently stir to combine. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 5-6 hours. Remove the garlic, thyme, and bay leaves.', '3. Before serving, make the sauce. Melt the butter in a skillet set over medium high heat.\xa0Add the mushrooms and season with salt and pepper. Cook undisturbed for 5 minutes. Add the sage and 1 tablespoon thyme, stir and continue cooking until the mushrooms have caramelized, 3-5 minutes. Remove the mushrooms from the skillet to a plate.', '4. Add the remaining 1/2 cup wine and scrape up any browned bits off the pan. Simmer 3-5 minutes or until the wine has reduced by about 1/3. Slowly pour in the cream and mustard. Bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer 5 minutes or until the sauce has thickened slightly. Remove from the heat and stir in the parmesan. Season the sauce with salt and pepper and crushed red pepper. Stir in the mushrooms.', '5. Serve the ribs over a bed of mashed potatoes and pour the cream sauce overtop. Enjoy!']

title: 30 Minutes Coq au Vin Chicken Meatballs
ingredients: ['ground turkey or chicken', 'egg', 'Panko bread crumbs', 'grated parmesan cheese', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'thick-cut bacon, chopped', 'yellow onion, chopped', 'garlic, minced or grated', 'carrots, chopped', 'cremini mushrooms, sliced', 'tomato paste', 'dry red wine, such as Cabernet Sauvignon', 'low sodium chicken broth', 'bay leaves', 'thyme sprigs', 'fresh parsley, chopped', 'mashed potatoes, for serving']
ingredients with measurement: {'ground turkey or chicken': '1 1/4', 'egg': '1', 'Panko bread crumbs': '1/3', 'grated parmesan cheese': '1/3', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'thick-cut bacon, chopped': '2-3', 'yellow onion, chopped': '1', 'garlic, minced or grated': '4', 'carrots, chopped': '4', 'cremini mushrooms, sliced': '2', 'tomato paste': '2', 'dry red wine, such as Cabernet Sauvignon': '1 1/2', 'low sodium chicken broth': '1', 'bay leaves': '2', 'thyme sprigs': '4', 'fresh parsley, chopped': '1/2', 'mashed potatoes, for serving': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment.', '2. Add the turkey, egg, bread crumbs, parmesan, and a pinch each of salt and pepper to a bowl. Coat your hands with a bit of olive oil and roll the meat into tablespoon-size balls (will make 15-20 meatballs), placing them on the prepared baking sheet. Transfer to the oven and bake for 15 minutes or until the meatballs are crisp and cooked through.', "3. Meanwhile, cook the bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 5 minutes. Remove the bacon and reserve. If there's excess bacon grease, drain off all but 1 tablespoon. To the skillet, add the onion and cook for 5 minutes, until softened and fragrant. Stir in the garlic, carrots, and mushrooms. Cook another 5 minutes, until the vegetables are caramelizing on the edges. Add the tomato paste. Cook 1 minute.", '4. Add in the red wine, chicken broth, bay leaves, and thyme. Season with salt and pepper. Stir to combine, bring the sauce to a boil, cook 10 minutes or until the sauce thickens slightly. Stir in the meatballs, cover and cook 5 minutes, until the meatballs are coated in the sauce. Remove the bay leaves and thyme and discard. Stir in the parsley and reserved bacon.', '4. Serve the meatballs and sauce over\xa0mashed potatoes.']

title: Better Than Takeout Dan Dan Noodles.
ingredients: ['sesame oil', 'garlic, thinly sliced or smashed', 'crushed red pepper flakes', 'low sodium soy sauce', 'hoisin sauce', 'honey', 'rice vinegar', 'creamy peanut butter or tahini', 'Chinese style egg noodles, or rice noodles', 'low sodium chicken broth', 'fresh baby spinach, roughly chopped', 'ground chicken or pork', 'mixed mushrooms, chopped', 'black pepper', 'medium shallot, chopped', 'green onions, chopped']
ingredients with measurement: {'sesame oil': '1/3', 'garlic, thinly sliced or smashed': '6', 'crushed red pepper flakes': '1-2', 'low sodium soy sauce': '1/2', 'hoisin sauce': '1/4', 'honey': '1', 'rice vinegar': '2', 'creamy peanut butter or tahini': '3', 'Chinese style egg noodles, or rice noodles': '8', 'low sodium chicken broth': '2 1/2', 'fresh baby spinach, roughly chopped': '2', 'ground chicken or pork': '1/2', 'mixed mushrooms, chopped': '2', 'black pepper': 'seasoning', 'medium shallot, chopped': '1', 'green onions, chopped': '4'}
instructions: ['1. To make the chili oil. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the 1/3 cup sesame oil, the garlic, and chili flakes. Cook, stirring occasionally until the garlic is fragrant, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and very carefully transfer the oil to a heat proof bowl or glass jar.', '2. Meanwhile, combine the soy sauce, hoisin sauce, honey, vinegar, peanut butter/tahini, and 1/3 cup water in a bowl.', '3. Cook the egg/rice noodles according to package directions.\xa0Drain and set aside. To the pot used to cook the noodles, add the broth and 1/2 of the soy sauce mixture. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, stir in the spinach. Keep warm.', '4. Place the skillet used to make the chili oil, over medium-high heat. Add 2 tablespoons oil and the chicken. Season with black pepper and brown all over, breaking it up as it cooks, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and shallot, and cook another 2-3 minutes. Slowly pour in 1/2 of the soy sauce mixture. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook until the sauce coats the chicken and the meat begins to caramelize and get crispy, about 5 minutes. Stir in 2-4 tablespoons chili oil. Remove from the heat.', '5. Ladle the broth into bowls. Add the noodles and toss combine. Spoon the meat over the noodles. Top with green onions and additional chili oil. Enjoy!']

title: Easiest One Pan Caprese Pesto Orzo Bake

instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 400° F.', '2. In a 9×13 inch baking dish, combine the tomatoes, olive oil, garlic, shallots, basil, chili flakes, salt, and pepper. Roast 10 minutes. title: Tajín Honey Lime Chicken and Jalapeño Corn Caesar Salad
ingredients: ['torn ciabatta bread', 'garlic, grated', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts', 'tajín', 'honey', 'lime zest and juice from 1-2 limes', 'shredded romaine lettuce', 'halved cherry tomatoes', 'grilled corn kernels', 'avocado, cubed', 'cubed spicy cheddar cheese', 'chopped scallions basil and or cilantro', 'jalapeños', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'tahini', 'lemon juice', 'dijon mustard', 'Worcestershire sauce', 'garlic, grated', 'grated parmesan']
ingredients with measurement: {'torn ciabatta bread': '2', 'garlic, grated': '1-2', 'extra virgin olive oil': '1/3', 'boneless skinless chicken breasts': '1', 'tajín': '2', 'honey': '2', 'lime zest and juice from 1-2 limes': 'seasoning', 'shredded romaine lettuce': '6', 'halved cherry tomatoes': '1 1/2', 'grilled corn kernels': '1', 'avocado, cubed': '1', 'cubed spicy cheddar cheese': '1', 'chopped scallions basil and or cilantro': '1/2', 'jalapeños': '1-2', 'tahini': '1/3', 'lemon juice': '2', 'dijon mustard': '2', 'Worcestershire sauce': '2', 'grated parmesan': '1/3'}
instructions: ['1. To make the dressing. Grill or char the jalapeños over an open flame until charred. Place in a bowl, cover, and steam 5 minutes. Chop these guys up.', '2. Combine all remaining ingredients except the jalapeños in a blender and blend until smooth. Mix in the jalapeños. Taste and adjust the salt.', '3. To make the salad. Set your grill, grill pan, or skillet to medium-high heat.', '4. Toss the ciabatta and garlic with 1 tablespoon olive oil. Grill the bread until grill marks appear, 5 minutes. Slide bread crumbs onto a plate. Season with salt.', '5. In a bowl, toss the chicken with 1 tablespoon olive oil, the tajín, honey, and salt. Grill the chicken until cooked through, about 8-10 minutes. Top with lime zest and juice. Thinly slice.', '6. Add the romaine, tomatoes, corn, avocado, cheese, herbs, chicken, croutons, and dressing. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.']

title: 30 Minute Herby Lemon Garlic Steak and Rice
ingredients: ['flank steak', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'fresh lemon juice', 'balsamic vinegar', 'shallot, thinly sliced', 'garlic, chopped', 'honey', 'dried oregano', 'salt, pepper, and chili flakes', 'cooked basmati rice', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'chopped fresh basil', 'chopped fresh cilantro', 'chopped fresh dill', 'lemon zest', 'garlic, chopped', 'avocado, sliced']
ingredients with measurement: {'flank steak': '2', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'fresh lemon juice': '1/4', 'balsamic vinegar': '2', 'shallot, thinly sliced': '1', 'garlic, chopped': '1', 'honey': '1', 'dried oregano': '1', 'salt, pepper, and chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'cooked basmati rice': '3', 'chopped fresh basil': '1/2', 'chopped fresh cilantro': '1/4', 'chopped fresh dill': '2', 'lemon zest': '2', 'avocado, sliced': '1'}
instructions: ['1. In a bowl, toss together the steak, olive oil, lemon juice, balsamic vinegar, garlic, honey, oregano, chili flakes, and a big pinch of salt. Mix well to coat/submerge the steak in the marinade. If time allows, marinate for 20 mins.', '2. Set your grill, grill pan, or skillet to medium-high heat. Grill the steak until lightly charred, 5-8 minutes for medium-rare, per side. Remove the steaks and allow them to rest for 5-10 minutes.', '3. Meanwhile, simmer any leftover marinade in a small pot set over medium heat for 5-10 minutes. Set aside for serving.', '4. To make the rice. Mix all ingredients in a bowl and season to taste with salt and pepper.', '5. \xa0Spoon the reserved sauce over the slices of steak, then serve the steak over plates or bowls of herby rice. Top with avocado. Enjoy!']

title: Broccoli Burrata Pasta Salad
ingredients: ['plain Greek yogurt or sour cream', 'mayo', 'buttermilk', 'fresh basil', 'fresh chopped chives', 'Worcestershire', 'garlic powder', 'onion powder', 'kosher salt and black pepper', 'prosciutto', 'short cut pasta', 'chopped broccoli', 'grilled corn', 'basil pesto', 'burrata cheese, at room temperature']
ingredients with measurement: {'plain Greek yogurt or sour cream': '1/2', 'mayo': '1/3', 'buttermilk': '2', 'fresh basil': '1', 'fresh chopped chives': '1/4', 'Worcestershire': '2', 'garlic powder': '1', 'onion powder': '1', 'kosher salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'prosciutto': '3', 'short cut pasta': '1', 'chopped broccoli': '2', 'grilled corn': '2', 'basil pesto': '1/4', 'burrata cheese, at room temperature': '8'}
instructions: ['1. To make the dressing. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth—season with salt and pepper.', '2. Preheat the oven to 400° F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and arrange the prosciutto in an even layer. Transfer to the oven and cook for 8-10 minutes, until crisp.', '3. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Boil the pasta to al dente, according to package directions. Add the broccoli during the last 2 minutes of cooking. Drain.', '4. In a large bowl, toss together the hot pasta with the dressing. Mix in the corn and pesto. Toss to coat.', '5. Serve warm or cold. The salad will develop more flavor as it sits. Add the burrata cheese and prosciutto just before serving.']

title: Hot Ranch Chicken and Bacon Sandwich
ingredients: ['plain greek yogurt or sour cream', 'mayo', 'buttermilk', 'dried parsley', 'dried chives', 'Worcestershire', 'garlic powder', 'onion powder', 'cayenne', 'salt and black pepper', 'Ciabatta bread, halved lengthwise', 'chicken breasts, cooked and thinly sliced', 'salsa verde', 'baby arugula', 'oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, chopped', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'chopped fresh dill', 'toasted sesame seeds', 'gouda or havarti cheese', 'pepperjack cheese', 'cooked crispy bacon']
ingredients with measurement: {'plain greek yogurt or sour cream': '1/2', 'mayo': '1/3', 'buttermilk': '2', 'dried parsley': '1', 'dried chives': '1', 'Worcestershire': '2', 'garlic powder': '1', 'onion powder': '1', 'cayenne': '1/4', 'salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'Ciabatta bread, halved lengthwise': '1', 'chicken breasts, cooked and thinly sliced': '2', 'salsa verde': '1/2', 'baby arugula': '2', 'oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, chopped': '1/2', 'fresh cilantro, chopped': '1/2', 'chopped fresh dill': '2', 'toasted sesame seeds': '2', 'gouda or havarti cheese': '6', 'pepperjack cheese': '6', 'cooked crispy bacon': '8'}
instructions: ['1. To make the dressing. Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Taste and adjust the salt and pepper.', '2. To make the sandwich. Preheat the oven to 400° F. Lay the bread, cut side up, on a cutting board. Working with the top piece of ciabatta, pull out some of the insides to create a space for the filling. Spread the ranch dressing over the bottom piece of bread. Layer the cheese and chicken on top and season with salt and pepper. Pour the salsa verde over the chicken. Bake for 15 minutes, until the cheese is melted.', '3. Meanwhile, toss the arugula with the sun-dried tomatoes, cilantro, dill, and sesame seeds. Season the with salt.', '4. Remove the sandwiches from the oven. Arrange the greens over the chicken. Add the bacon, then drizzle with additional dressing. Add the top half of the ciabatta and gently push down on the sandwich. Bake another 5 minutes until toasted.', '5. Remove from the oven. Slice into 6 sandwiches. Serve and enjoy!']

title: Sheet Pan Chicken Tinga Bowls
ingredients: ['boneless chicken breasts or thighs', 'red enchilada sauce', 'chipotle peppers in adobo, chopped', 'dried oregano', 'ground cumin', 'salt', 'bell peppers, sliced', 'yellow onion, sliced', 'cooked rice', 'shredded cheddar/cotija cheese', 'yogurt/sour cream + limes, for serving', 'avocados, chopped', 'jalapeño, seeded if desired, and chopped', 'fresh cilantro, chopped', 'lime juice', 'flaky salt']
ingredients with measurement: {'boneless chicken breasts or thighs': '1 1/2', 'red enchilada sauce': '3/4', 'chipotle peppers in adobo, chopped': '2-3', 'dried oregano': '1', 'ground cumin': '1', 'salt': '1', 'bell peppers, sliced': '2', 'yellow onion, sliced': '1', 'cooked rice': '3-4', 'shredded cheddar/cotija cheese': '1', 'yogurt/sour cream + limes, for serving': 'seasoning', 'avocados, chopped': '2-3', 'jalapeño, seeded if desired, and chopped': '1', 'fresh cilantro, chopped': '1/2', 'lime juice': '1/4', 'flaky salt': 'seasoning'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425° F.', '2. On a baking sheet, toss the chicken with 2 tablespoons olive oil, enchilada sauce, chipotle peppers, oregano, cumin, and salt.', '3. Add the bell peppers, onion, and 1 tablespoon olive oil. Season with salt and pepper and toss. Arrange everything evenly on the pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked and the peppers begin to char.', '4. Shred the chicken and toss with the sauce on the pan.', '5. Meanwhile, make the salsa. Add a dollop of yogurt + zest, and squeeze the limes over each bowl. Enjoy with warmed tortillas or chips. YUM!']

title: Baked Lemon Balsamic Salmon Bowls.
ingredients: ['balsamic vinegar', 'honey', 'tamari/soy sauce', 'garlic, chopped', 'dried thyme', 'dried oregano', 'chili flakes', 'salmon, cut into bite-size chunks', 'asparagus, ends trimmed', 'olive oil or sesame oil', 'salt and black pepper', 'avocados, diced', 'lemon juice', 'toasted nuts/seeds', 'mixed herbs, chopped', 'crumbled feta']
ingredients with measurement: {'balsamic vinegar': '1/3', 'honey': '4', 'tamari/soy sauce': '2', 'garlic, chopped': '2', 'dried thyme': '1', 'dried oregano': '1', 'chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'salmon, cut into bite-size chunks': '4', 'asparagus, ends trimmed': '1', 'olive oil or sesame oil': '2', 'salt and black pepper': 'seasoning', 'avocados, diced': '2', 'lemon juice': '2', 'toasted nuts/seeds': '2', 'mixed herbs, chopped': '1/2', 'crumbled feta': '1/2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 450° F.', '2. In a saucepan, combine balsamic vinegar, honey, tamari/soy sauce, garlic, thyme, oregano, and chili flakes. Set over medium heat. Bring to a boil for 3-4 minutes, until the sauce bubbles and begins to thicken. Remove from the heat.', '3. On a baking sheet, toss the salmon with half of the balsamic sauce and arrange in an even layer. Arrange the asparagus around the salmon, toss with 1 tablespoon of oil and season with salt and pepper.', '4. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked to your liking. During the last minute, switch the oven to broil and broil until lightly caramelized. Toss the salmon with the remaining balsamic sauce.', '5. Meanwhile, combine the avocado with 1 tablespoon of oil, lemon juice, herbs, nuts/seeds, and feta in a bowl. Season with salt.', '6. Spoon the asparagus and salmon over the bowls of rice. Top with lots of the avocado/feta salad mix. Enjoy!']

title: 20 Minute Honey Garlic Chicken
ingredients: ['chicken breasts or thighs, cut into cubes', 'garlic powder', 'black pepper and chile flakes', 'flour or gluten-free flour', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'broccoli florets or chopped asparagus', 'sesame seeds, for serving', 'tamari or soy sauce', 'lemon juice', 'honey', 'garlic, grated', 'chili paste', 'chopped green onion', 'toasted sesame oil']
ingredients with measurement: {'chicken breasts or thighs, cut into cubes': '2', 'garlic powder': '1', 'black pepper and chile flakes': 'seasoning', 'flour or gluten-free flour': '1/4', 'extra virgin olive oil': '4', 'broccoli florets or chopped asparagus': '3', 'sesame seeds, for serving': 'seasoning', 'tamari or soy sauce': '1/3', 'lemon juice': '2', 'honey': '3', 'garlic, grated': '6', 'chili paste': '3-4', 'chopped green onion': '2', 'toasted sesame oil': '1'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 450° F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or rub with oil.', '2. On the sheet pan, mix the chicken, garlic powder, pepper, and chile flakes. Add the flour and toss again. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, tossing to coat. Arrange the chicken to one side of the baking sheet. Add the broccoli/asparagus to the other side. Toss with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 10-15 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.', '3. Meanwhile, make the sauce. In a bowl or glass jar, combine all ingredients.', '4. Remove the vegetables from the sheet pan. Then pour the honey garlic sauce over the chicken and toss the chicken up in the sauce. Bake for another 5 minutes, until the sauce is baked onto the chicken.', "5. Serve the chicken, vegetables, and honey garlic sauce with green onions and toasted sesame seeds. I love this over rice, but it's also great as an appetizer too!"]

title: Sheet Pan Crispy Chicken Tacos with Roasted Jalapeño Sesame Verde
ingredients: ['skinless chicken, breast or thighs', 'extra virgin olive oil', 'yellow onion, chopped', 'chipotle peppers in adobo, chopped', 'chili powder', 'dried oregano', 'cumin', 'tamari/soy sauce', 'honey', 'corn tortillas, warmed', 'shredded Mexican cheese blend', 'avocado, cilantro, and limes for serving', 'garlic', 'green onions', 'jalapeño', 'salsa verde', 'tamari/soy sauce', 'toasted sesame seeds']
ingredients with measurement: {'skinless chicken, breast or thighs': '2', 'extra virgin olive oil': '2', 'yellow onion, chopped': '1', 'chipotle peppers in adobo, chopped': '2-3', 'chili powder': '1', 'dried oregano': '1', 'cumin': '1', 'tamari/soy sauce': '1', 'honey': '1', 'corn tortillas, warmed': '8-12', 'shredded Mexican cheese blend': '1', 'avocado, cilantro, and limes for serving': 'seasoning', 'garlic': '2', 'green onions': '3', 'jalapeño': '1', 'salsa verde': '1/2', 'toasted sesame seeds': '2'}
instructions: ['1. Preheat the oven to 425° F.', '2. On a baking sheet, toss the chicken with olive oil, onions, chipotle, chili powder, oregano, and cumin. Pour over the tamari and honey. Toss to coat. Arrange in a single layer. Add the garlic cloves, jalapeño, and green onions (for the salsa). Roast everything for 20 minutes or until the chicken is cooked.', '3. Remove the garlic cloves, jalapeño, and green onions from the sheet pan and add to a food processor. Let cool. Shred the chicken and toss with the sauce on the sheet pan.', '4. Line the taco shells up in a 9×13 inch baking dish. Bake for 5 minutes. Stuff the chicken into each taco shell and top with cheese. Bake for 10 minutes, until the cheese has melted.', '5. To make the sauce. Add the salsa verde and tamari to the food processor with the jalapeño. Blend until smooth. Stir in the sesame seeds.', '6. Serve each taco with the sesame verde sauce. Enjoy!']

title: Pineapple Adobo Chicken Skewers
ingredients: ['toasted sesame oil or olive oil', 'tamari or low sodium soy sauce', 'rice or apple cider vinegar', 'honey', 'jalapeños, seeded, if desired, and sliced', 'garlic, chopped', 'grated fresh ginger', 'chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-size chunks', 'fresh pineapple chunks', 'green onions and basil, for serving', 'mayo', 'sweet Thai chili sauce', 'ketchup', 'tamari/soy sauce', 'jalapeño, chopped', 'clove garlic, grated', 'lime zest', 'toasted sesame seeds']
ingredients with measurement: {'toasted sesame oil or olive oil': '2', 'tamari or low sodium soy sauce': '1/2', 'rice or apple cider vinegar': '1/2', 'honey': '3', 'jalapeños, seeded, if desired, and sliced': '1-2', 'garlic, chopped': '6', 'grated fresh ginger': '1', 'chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-size chunks': '1 1/2', 'fresh pineapple chunks': '3', 'green onions and basil, for serving': 'seasoning', 'mayo': '1/2', 'sweet Thai chili sauce': '1/3', 'ketchup': '2', 'tamari/soy sauce': '1', 'jalapeño, chopped': '1', 'clove garlic, grated': '1', 'lime zest': '2', 'toasted sesame seeds': '2'}
instructions: ['1. In a bowl, mix the olive oil, tamari/soy sauce, vinegar, honey, jalapeños, garlic, ginger, and a pinch of pepper. Add the chicken and toss. If time allows, let sit for 10 minutes to deepen the flavor.', '2. Take the skewers and thread the chicken with the pineapple chunks. Reserve the marinade.', '3. Set your grill, grill pan, or skillet to medium-high heat. Grill the skewers until lightly charred and cooked through, turning them occasionally throughout cooking, about 10 to 12 minutes total.', '4. Meanwhile, pour the reserved marinade into a small pot. Bring to a boil and cook 5 minutes, until reduced. Brush the sauce over the skewers after grilling.', '5. To make the sesame sauce: combine all ingredients in a bowl.', '6. Serve the chicken and pineapple with limes, green onions, and sesame sauce for dipping. Enjoy!']

title: Avocado Bacon Chicken Salad with Jalapeño Honey Mustard

title: 30 Minute Thai Basil Beef Noodles

ingredients with measurement: {'Pad Thai/wide rice noodles': '6', 'tamari or soy sauce': '1/3', 'Thai chili sauce': '1/4', 'fish sauce': '2', 'rice vinegar': '2', 'lemongrass paste': '1', 'black pepper and chili flakes': 'seasoning', 'sesame oil': '3', 'flank steak, thinly sliced': '1', 'bell peppers, thinly sliced': '2', 'butter, sliced': '2', 'shallot, sliced': '1', 'garlic, chopped': '4-6', 'chopped pickled ginger': '1', 'chopped cilantro or Thai basil': '1/2', 'green onions, chopped': '4', 'sesame seeds': '1/4', 'roasted peanuts, chopped': '1/3'}
